div.class: post-1264 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news

a.title: Permanent Link to Outrage Zero BPM Live World Tour

h2.a: Outrage Zero BPM Live World Tour

div.p: North and South America October/November 2011 – Email Judith for info and Bookings at bohjudith@hotmail.com
Australia,Asia – October/November 2011 – - Email Felicite for info and Bookings at hauntedmusic@yahoo.com
UK,EU – December/January 2011 Email Saskia for info and Bookings at info.temah@gmail.com

In the Drum & Bass scene, there are those who follow trends and those who pave their own way. Those who flock to the flavor of the month, while others stay true to the sounds within their souls and produce what they feel, and do so smashingly. Outrage is one of those producers, and over the last decade, he’s seen himself rise from a pirate radio DJ to a prominent producer, teaming up with the likes of Amit and Digital, and releasing tunes on a number of the scene’s finest imprints.

Zer0 BpM is an extension of what Outrage been doing with his 140bpm label J-Tek Records and his Backlash Records drum & bass baby since 2007. Now in the same place at the same time. Fuck genres and pigeonholing, It’s just Outrage Beats and FUN !
Now Outrage feel’s 100% confident with his sound and direction he want’s to take people on a journey with his new live set. Making people to laugh, cry, dance, smile, mosh and make love to his music. The live show consists of all his own works, live remixes, mash-ups, soundcapes, various BPMs and on-the-fly production.
There will be three parts to the Zer0 BpM EP each with six tracks with various BPMs. All on digital formats only.

div.class: post-1109 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news

a.title: Permanent Link to

div.p:
**OUTRAGE IN MIAMI**
as you all know Miami celebrates every year the Winter Music Conference and Ultra Music Festival. This year drum and bass represents once again during the Ultra week from March 22 to 27. If you are in Miami during Outrage will be playing on March 25 at the GANSEVOORT MIAMI BEACH HOTEL and on March 26 at the BASSDRIVE SESSIONS MIAMI 2011. We are currently waiting on confirmation to play at the Ultra Music Festival. Watch this space for more information!!

Those of you that have been lucky enough to experience the culture of Miami firsthand will have noticed that you can only get so far with the Queen’s beloved English, as the city is now largely populated by native Spanish speakers. According to MSN News, Hispanics make up 59% of the local community and it’s common to hear the local clubbers talking about ‘Las mejores fiestas del mundo’, the best parties in the world on South Beach…and they’re not wrong. LET’S HAV IT!!!

Located @
Loft 168
168 SE 1st St.
Downtown Miami, Florida

NORTH & SOUTH AMERICA TOUR 2011
March 5th through May 4th
It’s not too late yet to try and get your date in for the tour.
Now taking bookings! Contact Saskia: info.temah@gmail.com .

div.class: post-1087 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news

a.title: Permanent Link to

p.span: NEW RELEASE OUT NOW EXCLUSIVELY ON BEATPORT
RAIDEN + METH – “”THE BOB NUDD PROJECT” / “THE JOHN WILSON PROJECT” – BACKLASH 006!

div.p: Nice diversion of sounds for Backlash’s sixth outing. We’ve seen Raiden infusing the dubwise/tribal sounds into his productions, including the birth of his Voodoo Music imprint, but alongside Meth, Raiden marries his tech-fueled fury with the percussion-heavy funk on “The Bob Nudd Project”. Driven by a bouncy melody, this track is low on fancy bells and whistles, and heavy on rich kicks and guttural basstones. One to keep the crowd hype, indeed. On the flip, Raiden & Meth let the bass sing, as a hypnotic line comes front and center on this one. The dubbed out synths and effects slither in and out of the mix, added a sense of terror or doom to the proceedings, crafting a truly understated black horse journey. The odd linchpin in terms of the titles is that both Bob Nudd and John Wilson are fisherman, so maybe Raiden & Meth are envisioning these two falling off the boat, getting attacked by piranha, and these tracks play during their demise? Or did we just go a little too dark on ya…

p.span: Raiden and Meth – The Bob Nudd Project – BLR006 – OUT NOW by Backlash Records
Raiden and Meth – The John Wilson Project – BLR006 – OUT NOW by Backlash Records

div.p: Beatport: The Bod Nud Project/The John Wilson Project

a.title: Permanent Link to Temah is here !!!

div.p: Temah is a group of like minded electronic artists that have decided to join forces and promote their music. The crew really needs no introduction, Temah is made up of producers, DJs and MCs like Digital, Outrage, Raiden, Meth, Morphy, Kiat, Genotype and 2Shy MC and labels such as OffKey, Function, Backlash, Voodoo and its respective artists. Temah consists of a Records Label, Club Night and DJ Agency.

div.class: post-852 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news

a.title: Permanent Link to Outrage “Twisted” / “New Faces” Slated for June/July Release

h2.a: Outrage “Twisted” / “New Faces” Slated for June/July Release

div.p: Fifth release for Outrage’s Backlash Records imprint, and the funk has no sign of ceasing! We’ve got two dynamic plates on this one, and the fiery “Twisted” kicks things off. In his no-nonsense approach, this cut wastes no time in getting to the point: once the infectious bass is introduced, its go time! It’s an understated menace, with not too many elements mucking up the pressure – just snappy drums, a rumble of a bass and some interesting twists and turns to the main theme. Bombastic, try it on a ready crowd. On the flipside, Outrage goes a bit deeper with “New Faces”, bringing in a sinister growl and pairing it up with a bouncy bassline. Feels like the effects of a drug, blood rushing, lights skittering, all colors awash, and all you see are a sea of new faces. Welcome to the future. – khal(DOA)

a.title: Listen to TWISTED
Listen to NEW FACES

div.class: post-835 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news

a.title: Permanent Link to Outrage “Make or Break” / Digital + Outrage “Stampede” Out Now

h2.a: Outrage “Make or Break” / Digital + Outrage “Stampede” Out Now

div.p: Keepin’ it nice and nasty Backlash hits you with their fourth outing for this Spring/ Summer 2010.

Kickin’ things into high gear is the grimy rumble of Outrage’s “Make Or Break”, which builds on a simply effective melody that gets your head noddin’ and your waist windin’. Interesting tune to drop in your mix, with enough space to cause mass hysteria. Following that is another stellar collaborative banger from Digital and Outrage in the form of “Stampede”. It builds like an oncoming rush of wild animals…the intro plays the calm before you start seeing a cloud of dust kicked up, heightening anticipation and fear, which climaxes in the rush of that sweeping bassline. When this one drops, you get two choices: move or move out of the way! Big boy riddims on both sides of this plate, which is par for the course when it comes to Backlash. – khal(DOA)

a.title: Listen to MAKE OR BREAK
Listen to STAMPEDE

div.class: post-817 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news

a.title: Permanent Link to Outrage “K Zero 9″ / Digital + Outrage “Eclipse” Available Now!

h2.a: Outrage “K Zero 9″ / Digital + Outrage “Eclipse” Available Now!

div.p: Following up their critically-acclaimed Red Letter LP, Digital and Outrage link up for Outrage’s Backlash Records with “Eclipse”, a dub-soaked number to start 2010 proper! Lead by a thumping kick, this one is a dub-lovers dream, flowing with loads of effects, echo and perfectly-timed ragga vocals. There’s a lot of space in this one, allowing the elements to breathe, and the atmospherics feel like the soundtrack to the moon overtaking the sun. On the flip, Outrage’s “K Zero 9” finally makes it way to the record bins. This one has been tearing things down in its slow-burning venom, and is the perfect lick to get the party started, or send a ready crowd into a frenzy with its hypnotic bass. While the dub-side of Drum & Bass seems to be almost forgotten, its good to know that the torchbearers are still around, injecting tough riddims for those who know. – khal(DOA)

a.title: Listen to K ZERO 9
Listen to ECLIPSE

a.title: Permanent Link to FUNCTION RECORDS – RED LETTER REMIXES 12″

div.p:
2 tracks from Digital & Outrage’s newest venture RED LETTER get the
remix treatment from two of D&B’s big honcho’s.

‘FINAL DEMAND’ by DIGITAL+OUTRAGE (S.P.Y. REMIX)
S.P.Y. adds real class to FINAL DEMAND with his trademark minimal roll
out style.

‘ARMSHOUSE’ by OUTRAGE (TECH ITCH REMIX)
TECH ITCH shows the quality that has made him one of the scenes most
popular artists in the D&B scene with a monstrous mix of ARMSHOUSE.

FULL RELEASE MAY 10TH 2010
Distributed by SRD
Phone +44 20 8802 3000
70 Lawrence Road, Tottenham, London, N15 4EG
info-srd@srd.co.uk

div.class: post-680 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news

a.title: Permanent Link to This Friday! Abstractions – Bristol – April 16th

div.p:
DIGITAL & OUTRAGE (2 Hour Set)
(Function, Backlash, Metalheadz)
www.myspace.com/digitaloutrage

As hard times hit, it has become increasingly difficult to see a light at the end of the tunnel for many an artist, but out of the darkness and diversity of the current world climate comes ‘Red Letter’; the stunning debut album collaboration of two boundless imaginations – Digital & Outrage. Both producers are no stranger to collaborating, with Outrage having made a name for himself at the turn of the century allayed to Amit (then producing as Tronic) and has since gone on to team up with talented vocalist Kirsty Hawkshaw on his Whisper Audio imprint.

PESSIMIST
(Touched By, Buried Audio, Diffrent)
www.myspace.com/pessimistdnb

Also in Room One we have PESSIMIST who is set to have a massive 2010 with forthcoming releases on Hustle Audio and Influenza Minus. Check out his current release Whispers of Scandal on the newly launched Touched By Records which features a remix by S.P.Y

div.class: post-429 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news

a.title: Permanent Link to New Backlash Release coming soon

div.p: A: OUTRAGE “K ZERO 9” / AA: DIGITAL + OUTRAGE “ECLIPSE”

Following up their critically-acclaimed Red Letter LP, Digital and Outrage link up for Outrage’s Backlash Records with “Eclipse”, a dub-soaked number to start 2010 proper! Lead by a thumping kick, this one is a dub-lovers dream, flowing with loads of effects, echo and perfectly-timed ragga vocals. There’s a lot of space in this one, allowing the elements to breathe, and the atmospherics feel like the soundtrack to the moon overtaking the sun. On the flip, Outrage’s “K Zero 9” finally makes it way to the record bins. This one has been tearing things down in its slow-burning venom, and is the perfect lick to get the party started, or send a ready crowd into a frenzy with its hypnotic bass. While the dub-side of Drum & Bass seems to be almost forgotten, its good to know that the torchbearers are still around, injecting tough riddims for those who know.

-Khal (dogsonacid.com)
DJ Support: Grooverider, Goldie, Randall, Doc Scott, Storm, Amit, Loxy, Marcus Intalex, Raiden, Tech Itch, Spirit, A-Sides

div.class: post-434 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news

a.title: Permanent Link to Heads Up! Welcome to the new Backlash site!

h2.a: Heads Up! Welcome to the new Backlash site!

div.p: We are proud to present the new Backlash website!

We’ve worked hard over the last few months to create a place that can be the hub of all things Backlash. Here you can learn about new releases and artists, find new media, and much more. Subscribe to the newsletter on the main page(bottom right hand corner) for upfront news, exclusive mixes and free tracks. Connect with us through our blog and social media or listen to our MP3 downloads; at the end of the day, all we want to do is make you dance.
This is a huge step for Backlash and we are excited for you to be a part of it!

div.div:
